description: Allied Irish Banks acquires 80 percent of Bank Zachodni, Poland's ninth largest bank, from state treasury for $580 million, about 15 percent more than analysts had expected (S)
title: WORLD BUSINESS BRIEFING: EUROPE; POLISH BANK PURCHASE
title_page: WORLD BUSINESS BRIEFING: EUROPE; POLISH BANK PURCHASE - The New York Times
text:
Ireland's largest bank, Allied Irish Banks P.L.C., made another major investment in Polish banking and financial services. Allied Irish Banks bought 80 percent of Bank Zachodni from the state treasury for $580 million, about 15 percent more than analysts had expected. In 1991, Allied Irish Banks bought 60 percent of the Wielkopolski Bank Kreditowy. Bank Zadochni is Poland's ninth largest, in terms of deposits, and has 6,981 employees.
James F. Clarity(NYT)
